msbt.message: You knowadding one tiny piece of decor or furniture can completely transform a room. That said, I wouldn't change a thing in here. It's SO you.
I'm not sure what the technical term is for it, but your room has that certain"I don't know what."
For a long time, the trend in storage was to hide everything away.But now it's the opposite! Open storage is all the rage.It just goes to show you: you simply must redecorate every six months.
I, for one, say that going out is overrated! What's better than staying in and enjoying a friend's company?
They say that you can learn everything you need to know about someone by looking at their room. But it's quite simply not true.<10_4 /> You have to have a good look at their shoe collection as well!
Don't you think the layout here is just so fresh and energetic? That is a design guru!
Oh, I could get used to a place like thisI'm in awe of 's sense of style.
I didn't know you were friendly with .We should all sit down with a nice mug of and have a chat later, !

Darling, I applaud your minimalistic approach to interior decorating. It's so very modern of you. That said, I do look forward to seeing what you add to this space. Whatever it is, it's sure to make an impression.

My goodness, you do seem to enjoy a simple life unburdened by material goods. But have you considered adding at least one piece of furniture?A chair, perhaps! Or maybe a lamp? Really, darling, anything will do.
I see you haven't placed a single piece of furniture yet.I, for one, appreciate your careful approach to interior decorating. One mustn't rush important decisions!
